page.title: 05BENENDEN WEALD, PONDS.
page.content: One of the many features of this area that a casual observer would not notice is the ponds which are tucked away in odd wooded corners between fields and are only visible for a short distance. In one grid square there are 27 ponds which cover an area of over l00 square metres, giving a total of over 800 square metres, a sizeable area for such a detail of the landscape. These silent places are haunted by moorhens and overhung by the blackish-green foliage of the oak. Clumps of flags and willows line the water and are mirrored in its placid surface. Only odd shafts of sunlight penetrate to the surface pondweed crossed by bird tracks. One or two ponds are are at the roadside and even they are often hidden away in intimate and private beauty.
